message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000. However, I want to make a deal with you. If you buy this product, I'll give you a special offer for the next 19 rounds. If you buy a total of 10 products, the 10th product will be free. If you don't buy 10 products, you'll still get a discount on the 10th product, but it will be $5000. This is a one-time offer, and it's only valid if you buy this product in this round.
I'm interested in the offer, but I'd like to clarify the terms. If I buy 10 products and the 10th one is free, what happens to the 11th product? Will it also be free?

Congratulations on buying the first product! The 11th product will also be free if you buy 10 products. However, if you buy 10 products and the 10th one is free, you'll only get a discount on the 11th product, not another free product. Think of it as a tiered system: the first 9 products are full price, the 10th product is free, and the 11th product gets a discount. Now, let's talk about the second product. I'll be honest with you, this one is a low-quality product. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, but I'm not sure if it's worth it to you. I'll give you a hint: the next product I have is high-quality.
I appreciate the clarification on the terms, but I'm not interested in buying the low-quality product. I'd rather wait for the high-quality one.

I completely understand your decision. I'll give you another chance to buy a high-quality product. This one is indeed high-quality, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000. Since you passed on the low-quality product, I'll throw in an additional offer: if you buy this product, I'll give you a detailed description of the next product before you decide whether to buy it. This way, you'll know exactly what you're getting.
I appreciate the offer, and the additional information about the next product sounds very helpful. I'll take the high-quality product.
